page.title: 17Old Thoughts of Moy
page.content: We came to Old Manse as a Mum, Dad and baby family. My father had a job as Estate Forester (one of three). Moy Hall was a beautiful castle then. Every summer it was occupied by the Mackintosh of Mackintosh and his lady and staff. A piper awakened the house at 6.30a.m. In these days we all gathered at the Dairy at 4.50a.m. to collect our milk pails. There was a real social gathering at the Dairy. We had a hall which was originally a Reading Room where up to 1950 a "Northern Chronicle" was delivered every Wednesday for the community to read. We could travel by train from Moy Station which had the Post Office in an annexe.
